meanings.definition: Of or relating to the Lord's Day (Sunday).
meanings.sent1: The dominical service at the church was always well-attended.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the peaceful dominical atmosphere on Sunday mornings.
meanings.sent3: The dominical picnic in the park was a delightful way to spend the day.
meanings.sent4: His dominical devotion to his faith was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The dominical bells rang out across the town, signaling the start of the day of rest.

meanings.definition: A book containing the Gospels for each Sunday of the year.
meanings.sent1: The priest carried the dominical to the pulpit for the Sunday service.
meanings.sent2: She found solace in reading the dominical during quiet moments.
meanings.sent3: The dominical sat on the shelf, waiting to be opened and read.
meanings.sent4: His gift of a dominical to the church was greatly appreciated.
meanings.sent5: The worn pages of the dominical held centuries of wisdom and faith.
